text:
Pours dark brown with a large head.
Nose shows cocoa, sweet toasty and bready malt, raisins, chocolate fudge, soft peppery notes and delicate coffee.
Flavours include more coffee, some soft cocoa, sultanas, golden syrup and follows with a harsh bitterness and a a chalky, dry finish.
Carbonation is very aggressive for the style of beer.
I usually absolutely adore doppelbocks but this one mostly missed what make the style so awesome - this intense, rich and sweet bready malt notes.

33 cl bottle. Pours dark brown to black, huge brown head. Aroma is thick malty. Minerals. Metallic. Roasted malty. Bitter and roasted dark malty. Mild chocolate and caramelish. Bitter and metallic. Dry and toasted finish.
Bottle - black with a beige head. Toasted and medium roasted malty with notes of cocoa, dark fruit, coffee roast, some caramel, roasted nutty, hoppy bitter finish.

Phenoloschokocacaopowder Oustander mit deutlich bitteren Ultrahopabgang. Es knistert espressosäuerlich und raucht gewaltig, da darf die nötige Alkoholschwere nicht fehlen. Es cremt und imperialstoutet. Oatmealattack!! Hammerdessertoptik inklusive. Top. Aber nichts erinnert an ein Doppelbocker. Thanx Scootie. 0,33l Buddel.
Bottle from Voldby. Pours black with a good beige head. Aroma and taste is roasted malts, coffee, chocolate, dark dried fruits, licorice. Full body. Soft carbonation. Bitter roasted finish.

F: brownish, medium size, not long lasting.
C: dark, opaque.
A: dark malt, caramel, chocolate, cocoa, a bit of coffee, dark dried fruits.
T: malty, chocolate, lingering coffee, light herbal, cocoa, dry on the palate, medium to full body, medium carbonation, very good, enjoyed. Sampled from tap @ Salon Piva in Bratislava.

On tap at Salón piva 2017.
Colour​: reddish black
Aroma: roasted malt, chocolate, dates, figs
Taste: very rich, with fruits, coffee, dates, long bitter finish
Tap at Salon piva. Assertively roasty, with loads of chocolate flavour. Med-low alcoholic heat which works as a counterbalance to the rich full sweet body. Very tasty and relatively easy drinking.
Tap at Salon piva. <:i>Brown color with medium beige head. Aroma of roasted malt, coffee. Taste, coffee, roasted malt, licorice.

Bottle. Teku. Pitch black with moderate to high thick, light brown head. Perfect lacing and head retention. Heavy malty aroma up-front, typical - bread, caramel. Moderately fruity, nutty. Moderately roasted. After warming up light booziness is all-around. Cant find any dates, neither figs. Taste is heavy sweet and moderate to light heavy bitter, pretty balanced. The bitterness is long, increasing and quite noticeable in the aftertaste. Medium to full body, oily and thick texture, soft to average carbonation. In overall nice, thick and malty brew with quite strong for that style bitterness. Once again too roasted beer my by Tool, lower fermentation is not their strongest point.

Aroma: nuts and dark roasted malt. 
Flavour: A strong flavour of nuts and roasted malt some sweet fruity notes. Aftertaste is malt and chocolate. 
Colour: dark brown with a light brown head. 
From: Bottle @ FLASK Aarhus Feb. 2016.

Draft glass @ Gollem. Black, huge creamy lacing mocha head. Nose is mocha, caramel, chocolate & chocolate syrup, sugar, faint licorice, almost hint of varnish styled alcohol. Taste is thick soy sauce mocha, herbal roots, pure syrup & BBQ sauce, chocolate syrup, low coffee, lightly warming. Rich decadent, very thick deep chocolate & BBQ sauce notes. Doppelbock? This tastes like a very lovely Baltic Porter.

Bottle, 9%. Very dark brown with big beige head. Aroma is roasted malt, caramel, chocolate, bread and liquorice. Flavour is roasted malts, chocolate, coffee, dark fruit, little bread, liquorice, medium sweet, hop and medium bitter.

Draught at Taphouse.
Black colored with a small off-white head.
Malty aroma of caramel, bread and licorice with notes of dried fruits.
Malty flavor of caramel, licorice, hops and dried fruits.
Hoppy finish.

Draft. A black beer with a lazing dark brown head. The aroma has notes of roasted malt and chocolate. The flavor is sweet with notes of roasted malt, liquorice, and chocolate, leading to a bitter finish.
